choices.A: use of certificates instead of username and password

questions.question_text: Which requirement is needed to use local authentication for Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Clients that connect to a FlexVPN server?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
EAP-AnyConnect

Selected Answer: A
Here is the difference EAP-AnyConnect is a proprietary auth method to connect clients via Flex local database. However, at a minimum the server requires a certificate to identify itself to the client... The client uses the password/username to auth method to a username line on the router. So, the certificate is the minimum for either option.

Selected Answer: A
From the URL in the solution box: 
Configure

Authentication and Authorization of users with the Local Database

Note: In order to authenticate users against the local database on the router, EAP needs to be used. However, to use EAP, the local authentication method must be rsa-sig, so the router needs a proper identity certificate, and it cannot use a self-signed certificate."
D is the most correct answer

To use local authentication for Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Clients connecting to a FlexVPN server, you would need to use the AnyConnect profile. The AnyConnect profile allows you to define the authentication method as "Local" within the XML configuration file. This allows users to authenticate using the local user database on the FlexVPN server itself. EAP-AnyConnect, on the other hand, is used for authentication methods that rely on external authentication servers such as RADIUS or LDAP.

I think the answer should be "B". AnyConnect-EAP, also known as aggregate authentication, allows a Flex Server to authenticate the AnyConnect client via the Cisco proprietary AnyConnect-EAP method.
Link: 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/flexvpn/200555-FlexVPN-AnyConnect-IKEv2-Remote-Access.html#toc-hId-812524821

Selected Answer: A
When utilizing local authentication for Cisco AnyConnect Secure Mobility Clients connecting to a FlexVPN server, certificates are typically used as the authentication method. This means that instead of using a traditional username and password, the client presents a valid certificate to authenticate with the server.

Selected Answer: B
B. EAP-AnyConnect
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/flexvpn/200555-FlexVPN-AnyConnect-IKEv2-Remote-Access.pdf
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/flexvpn/200555-FlexVPN-AnyConnect-IKEv2-Remote-Access.html

I would go for A

see 
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/flexvpn/200555-FlexVPN-AnyConnect-IKEv2-Remote-Access.html


Authenticating and Authorizating users using the Local Database

Note:
 In order to authenticate users against the local database on the router, EAP needs to be used. However, in order to use EAP, the local authentication method has to be rsa-sig, so the router needs a proper certificate installed on it, and it can't be a self-signed certificate.
EAP isn't necessary for Local authentication

Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: B
B. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/security/flexvpn/200555-FlexVPN-AnyConnect-IKEv2-Remote-Access.html

questions.question_text: Which IKE identity does an IOS/IOS-XE headend expect to receive if an IPsec Cisco AnyConnect client uses default settings?

//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which VPN technology is allowed for users connecting to the Employee tunnel group?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
the tunnel group Employee doens have any specific group applied which means it will use the dfltgrpPolicy, in the dfltgrpPolicy only clientless is enabled, so the correct answer is D, Clientless

Selected Answer: D
Employees do not specify a group policy, so default group policy will be used.

Selected Answer: D
D - nothing is declared in the Employee group-policy so it falls back to the default group policy.

Selected Answer: D
When you configure other group policies, any attribute that you do not explicitly specify takes its value from the default group policy. To view the default group policy. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa72/configuration/guide/conf_gd/vpngrp.html

Selected Answer: D
correct answer is D

Answer should be D

Since there is no vpn-tunnel-protocol defnied under the Employee tunnel-group this setting will be inherited from the DfltGrpPolicy
And only ss-clientless is allowed in DfltGrpPolicy.
D should be the correct answer.

Users get their attributes from group policies. A connection profile identifies the group policy for a specific connection. If you do not assign a particular group policy to a user, the default group policy for the connection applies

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/security/asa/asa94/config-guides/cli/vpn/asa-94-vpn-config/vpn-groups.html

The tunnel-group Employee has no entry for a specific default-group-policy as with the Admin-Group.
The group-policy DfltGrpPolicy is used instead. This permits only ssl-clientless.

Answer D - clientless is correct.

choices.B: ISAKMP packets from spoke2 to spoke1
choices.C: ESP packets from spoke1 to spoke2
choices.D: ISAKMP packets from spoke1 to spoke2
choices.A: ESP packets from spoke2 to spoke1

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
zero decaps on spoke2, so A is the correct answer
A. It Seems correct since Spoke2 is encrypting traffic and sending it.
it should be ip nhrp registration timeout 40 but cause the other values are more then the ip nhrp holdtime the only that we can accept is C there

C 
ip nhrp holdtime should be higher than ip nhrp registration timeout (time all in seconds)
vote C
Correct Answer: D
This one is C
IP nhrp registration timeout (seconds) Sets the time between periodic registration messages. By default, this is set to one-third of the value of the NHRP hold time or 40 minutes.

C makes the most sense

https://www.globalknowledge.com/us-en/resources/resource-library/articles/understanding-next-hop-resolution-protocol-commands/
C. by default registration timeout is 1/3 of the holdtime..40 minutes of 2 hour holdtime.
I go with C. The rest of the options seems the tunnel will go down.
